name: hybrid_enhanced_commitment
algorithm:
1. Classify units into must-on (cannot turn off due to min up-time/shutdown constraints), must-off (cannot turn on due to min down-time), free-on (online units that can be turned off), and free-off (offline units that can be turned on).  
2. Compute effective min/max outputs considering ramp constraints: for online units (max(p_min, p_prev - ramp_down), min(p_max, p_prev + ramp_up)); for potential startups (p_min, min(p_max, startup_ramp)).  
3. If must-on min exceeds load, commit only must-on at min outputs (over-generation).  
4. Else if must-on max covers load, commit only must-on units.  
5. Else:  
   a. Initially commit must-on and free-on.  
   b. If total max < load, add free-off units by cost-efficiency (startup + min-output cost)/min-output.  
   c. If total min > load, remove non-must units by highest cost per MW from committed set while maintaining feasibility.  
6. Dispatch using priority heap:  
   a. Initialize outputs at effective min.  
   b. Distribute deficit to units with lowest marginal cost until load met or capacity exhausted.  
   c. Handle over-generation by accepting min outputs.  
7. Assign commitment states and outputs to all units.
